content.question: A student must analyze data collected from an experiment in which a block of mass <math alttext="2 M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> traveling with a speed <math alttext="v initial" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> collides with a block of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that is initially at rest. After the collision, the two blocks stick together. Which of the following applications of the equation for the conservation of momentum represent the initial and final momentum of the system for a completely inelastic collision between the blocks? Justify your selection. Select two answers.

choices.label: <math alttext="2 M v initial equals 3 M v final" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the blocks stick together after the collision.

<math alttext="3 M v initial equals 3 M v final" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the blocks stick together after the collision.

<math alttext="2 M v initial equals, 2 M v final, plus M v final" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the blocks stick together after the collision.

<math alttext="2 M v initial equals, M v initial, plus 3 M v final" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the blocks do not stick together after the collision.

content.answer: <math alttext="2 M v initial equals 3 M v final" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the blocks stick together after the collision.
